titleStmt.title: Genealogy of John Pattison, of Morrisville, New York, USA

availability.p: Copyright © 2018–2020, Christopher Alan Mosher, Shelton, Connecticut, USA.
availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

sourceDesc.bibl: Unknown author, possibly Eleanor Taylor daughter of Alice Morehouse, [Genealogy of John Pattison], circa 1980; supplied by Frederick Mosher, Hamilton, New York. Three typewritten pages of various information about the Pattison (Patterson) family of Morrisville, New York; some notations added in pen; other notations made by Christopher Mosher, not transcribed here.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

creation.rs: probably in the vicinity of Hamilton, New York

Burried in Morrisville CemetaryCemetery:
Olive Pattison, whose second husband was Peleg Slocum
Olive M. PattisonandHenry S,Slocum
B. Jan.15,1842DB. Nov.24,1842

Frank B.Slocum

Ella V. Pattison
B. 1852
D. Jan.29, 1889
John Pattison lived in Morrisville at one time.
Olive Pattison Slocum lived in Morrisville.
Henry Slocum was furniture dealer and undertaker in Morrisville,no children, moved to
Kansas, took to KansassdandelionKansas dandelion seeds.
Sarah Jane and Algene Lovejoy burried in Cole Hill CemetaryCemetery.
Alta Lovejoy Mosher and William Mosher in Cole Hill CemetaryCemetery.
Alice Morehouse Taylor's cousins:
Jessie Lovejoy Ross
Addie Lovejoy Head
Alta Lovejoy Mosher
Celia Stanton Egbert (Skaneateles)
Elta Stanton Totman (Ormond)
James Stanton (Ormond, Fla.)
Carrie Duffy (Oneida )
Hattie Duffy Vanoorhees (Rochester)
Oliva Dunnigan Harvey (Eaton)
Elizabeth Dunnigan
Gertrude Morgan Way (Eaton)
George Morgan (DeRuyter)
Edna Van Evera Nolan (Knoxboro)
Mrs. Lyman Ross worte me this: Fred Ross was Lyman Ross' father, Jessie Lovejoy, his mother.
There are two POlives in the Pattison family, the first died when she was three years old.
Olive Green Pattison was 75 yrs. old when she died of apoplexy.
Sarah Jane Pattison Lovejoy was born in Pompey, N.Y. She was about 70 years old when she
died of pneumonia.
The house that Sarah Jane and her husband lived in,on Cole Hill ,was still standing the last
time the rRosses were there. One time it was a beautiful home and a regular showplace, but it
has had several owners and has not been taken care of. Jessie Lovejoy was married from that
home.. Mrs. Ross also wrote she had talked with Gladys Head Elliot, who lives on a farm just
outside of Oriskany Falls, who knows some of the family facts.She told her that Julia Ann
Stanton died in Oriskany Falls in either 1912 or 1918.
Sarah Jane married Algene Lovejoy (Algenus?)
Their Children:
Adalaidemarried DeWitt Head
Alta" William George Mosher
Jessie" Fred Monroe Ross
Harriet ElizamarriedAlva Morehouse
